byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.
byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and SOMINI SENGUPTA

abstract: Nearly 30,000 foreign combatants have traveled to Syria, many to join Islamic State; number doubles 2014 estimate in just 12 months and points to failings of international effort to stem flow of terrorist reinforcements; assessment comes as Pres Obama prepares to return to United Nations year after rallying allies to pass Security Council resolution to address issue.
lead_paragraph: Nearly 30,000 foreign recruits have now poured into Syria to join the civil war, stark evidence that an international effort to enforce antiterrorism laws is not diminishing the militants’ ranks.

headline.main: Thousands Enter Syria to Join ISIS Despite Global Efforts
headline.print_headline: Thousands Enter Syria to Assist Militants in ISIS

snippet: Nearly 30,000 foreign recruits have now poured into Syria to join the civil war, stark evidence that an international effort to enforce antiterrorism laws is not diminishing the militants’ ranks.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
